adjective.description: In a state of pitiful or contemptible intellectual or moral ignorance, typically owing to a lack of opportunity.
examples: they saw themselves as bringers of culture to poor benighted peoples
a storm developed and we were forced to wait benighted near the summit

origin: Late 16th century (in benighted (sense 2)): past participle of archaic benight cover in the darkness of night, obscure (see be-, night).
